# Planning Division

The Planning Division (PD) maintains the County’s Comprehensive Plan and processes all suggested and required amendments to the Plan text and map; evaluates land use and development proposals for conformity with the Comprehensive Plan and measures related environmental, development and public facility impacts; prepares various planning and policy studies which explore development, land use, environmental and public facility issues, and offers recommendations for future direction; and assists in the development of the County’s Capital Improvement Program.

If you need assistance with a question regarding the Comprehensive Plan, including information about Comprehensive Plan amendments, what types of land uses are permitted in a specific location, heritage resources, public facilities, or environmental policy, please contact the Planner of the Day by phone at 703-324-1380 or by email at dpzpd@fairfaxcounty.gov.

The Planning Division consists of six branches that perform the duties listed below.

### Development Review 

  * Reviews zoning applications for conformance with the Comprehensive Plan
  * Reviews Interjurisdictional, ROW Vacation and Conservation easement requests
  * Conducts targeted Comprehensive Plan updates and reviews amendments 
  * Manages the Agricultural and Forestal District (A&F) Program



### Environmental Policy and Plan Development

  * Supports environmentally-focused comprehensive planning initiatives 
  * Conducts Comprehensive Plan updates, amendments, and planning studies
  * Provides Wetlands Board and Airports Advisory Committee support 



### Heritage Resources and Plan Development

  * Conducts Historic Preservation Planning and provides Architectural Review Board and History Commission support
  * Provides interpretations of the County’s Comprehensive Plan
  * Conducts Comprehensive Plan updates, amendments, planning studies



### Monitoring and Plan Development

  * Interprets and assembles data for Land Use and Transportation Studies
  * Prepares county employment forecasts for the Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments and others
  * Assesses Comprehensive Plan development potential
  * Conducts Comprehensive Plan updates, amendments, and trends analyses



### Policy and Plan Development

  * Provides interpretations of the County’s Comprehensive Plan
  * Conducts Comprehensive Plan updates, amendments, and planning studies
  * Manages the Site-Specific Plan Amendment (SSPA) process management



### Public Facilities and Plan Development

  * Conducts public facilities planning and review
  * Assists with the Capital Improvements Program
  * Conducts targeted Comprehensive Plan updates and reviews amendments
